intro: Bupleurum zoharii, commonly known as the Zohari's angelica, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of North Africa. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with finely divided leaflets that give it a delicate appearance. Bupleurum zoharii is often found in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its deep root system.
